html:
7.15.19  8:50 pm   about a year and a half ago i was having trouble getting a project done, and i "snapped", like you have described yourself doing in the past. i went into power mode and finished it in about three months.

but after that, i had no project to work on, no clear successor, so i un-snapped and went back to doing what i was doing before. now i have a successor, but despite attempts, can't seem to "re-snap".

how do i do so?

      how do i muster up those same feelings on demand?

7.15.19  8:04 pm   hey i saw you mentioned spider-verse in here, what do you think about it,

      and could you please rate it out of 10?

i just think its nuts

7.15.19  12:12 am   im here again. ive felt different every time i come to you. im tired of working and not working. i want to stop doing everything, i want to be perfect, i dont know how to work, ive failed but it means nothing. i dont know. i do know, but i dont know what to do. i do know what to do, but i just cant. why do i make myself incapable of work?

7.14.19  12:31 pm   Hey Bill. A couple weeks ago, I started making music. It's nothing crazy or anything, but it's just that lately I haven't been enjoying video games quite as much so it's something else to do. I kind of have two questions, though. Firstly, I was wondering how you start writing a song.

      For me, I've just hit a few piano notes at random until I heard a little melody that I liked just by coincidence and that's where I start,

      but it sort of feels like I'm cheating because I imagine real musicians put a lot more thought into their music.

      My other question is: do you think it's okay for songs to be short. I've never made anything longer than a minute. Maybe this was a weird question, I dunno. Thanks though.
7.14.19  11:25 am   Are you going to keep tweeting?
7.14.19  10:45 am   WHAT GAVE YOU THE IDEA TO START THIS TECHNOLOGIBOB IN THE FIRST PLACE.
